chargeHist.descr: Armed Robbery with Use of Force

result.execSummary:
The defendant Jerrell L Washington was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery with Use of Force [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).
  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Party to a Crime, Use Dangerous Weapon (Felony 2-5 Yrs)], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).
  • Armed Robbery with Use of Force [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).
  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Party to a Crime, Use Dangerous Weapon (Felony 2-5 Yrs)], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).
  • Robbery with Use of Force [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(a).
  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).
  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).
  • Armed Robbery with Use of Force [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).
  • Robbery with Use of Force [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(a).
  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).
  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Hearing April 21, 2016.

As to count one:  Submit a DNA sample and pay the mandatory DNA surcharge if not already done.
No DNA sample or DNA surcharge on counts 2-11 as it has been ordered on count one.
Pay all costs, fees, restitution and surcharges.  Collected by DOC out of up to 25% prison funds and wages.  Any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with counts two, three and four; but consecutive to any other counts and to any other sentence.  Credit for 335 days.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain full time employment.  Obtain high school diploma or GED.

No illegal drugs.  No controlled substances without valid prescription.  No contact with drug community.
No contact with the victims:  Ryan G., Brian B., Brett Z., Heather S., Samuel S., Jeremy B. and the coactors Jelani Clements, Demetrius Akbar, Demetrius Rimmer.

Mental health assessment. Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
Cognitive Behavior Therapy.
Alcohol and drug assessment. Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.  No positive results.

supervisions.notes: Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by DOC, but to include: those as listed.

Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms/body armor or weapons.
Civil rights suspended until reinstated.

Defendant Jerrell L Washington in court with attorney Joseph Richard Reback.  Defendant Jerrell L Washington in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel informed the Court there has been a breakdown in communication and he has not reviewed the PSI with his client.  The defendant would like a new attorney.  The Court denied defendant's motion and allowed counsel time to review the PSI with his client before sentencing.

Case passed:
Case recalled:
Same appearances:

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant.  Additional statement by Sheila W.  

COUNTS 1-4 ARE CONCURRENT TO EACH OTHER BUT CONSECUTIVE TO OTHER COUNTS AND TO ANY OTHER SENTENCE.

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 10 years.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 7 years with credit for 335 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 years.

AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 3 years.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 2 years with credit for 0 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 1 year.

AS TO COUNT 3:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 10 years.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 7 years with credit for 0 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 years.

AS TO COUNT 4:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 3 years.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 2 years with credit for 0 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 1 year.

COUNTS 5-7 ARE CONCURRENT TO EACH OTHER BUT CONSECUTIVE TO OTHER COUNTS AND TO ANY OTHER SENTENCE.

AS TO COUNT 5:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 7 years.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 5 years with credit for 0 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 years.

AS TO COUNT 6:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 3 years.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 2 years with credit for 0 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 1 year.

AS TO COUNT 7:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 2 years.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 1 year with credit for 0 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 1 year.

COUNT 8 IS CONSECUTIVE TO ANY OTHER SENTENCE.

AS TO COUNT 8:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 9 years.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 6 years with credit for 0 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 years.

COUNTS 9-11 ARE CONCURRENT TO EACH OTHER BUT CONSECUTIVE TO OTHER COUNTS AND TO ANY OTHER SENTENCE.

AS TO COUNT 9:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 9 years.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 6 years with credit for 0 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 years.

AS TO COUNT 10:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 2 years.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 1 year with credit for 0 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 1 year.

AS TO COUNT 11:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 3 years.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 2 years with credit for 0 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 1 year.

Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:

*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*No contact with the victims:  Ryan G., Brian B., Brett Z., Heather S., Samuel S., Jeremy B. and the co-actors Jelani Clements, Demetreus Akbar, Demetrius Rimmer
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Obtain high school diploma or GED.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

Restitution to be determined.

- AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample and pay the mandatory DNA surcharge if not already done.
- No DNA sample or DNA surcharge ordered on counts 2-11 as it has been ordered on count 1.
- Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms/body armour or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs, fees, restitution and surcharges, collected by DOC out of up to 25% prison funds and wages, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and does qualify for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 22 years initial confinement in this case.

Appeal rights given.  
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Pretrial Incarceration Credit.    Court ordered case adjourned for restitution hearing in Branch 26.  Restitution hearing scheduled for April 21, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

On the same day, at the hour of 11:29 a.m., the jury returned and by their foreperson, brought in a verdict as follows:  Dated this 28th day of January, 2016.  Timothy H, Foreperson."

"We, the jury, find the defendant, GUILTY of Armed Robbery, (Use of force), As a Party to a Crime, in the manner and form as charged in count 1 of the amended information relating to Ryan G.  
"We, the jury, find the defendant, GUILTY of Substantial Battery (Substantial Bodily Harm with Intent to Cause Bodily Harm),  As a Party to a Crime, in the manner and form as charged in count 2 of the amended information relating to Ryan G.
"We, the jury, find the defendant, GUILTY of Armed Robbery, (Use of force), As a Party to a Crime, in the manner and form as charged in count 3 of the amended information relating to Brian B.   
"We, the jury, find the defendant, GUILTY of Substantial Battery (Substantial Bodily Harm with Intent to Cause Bodily Harm),  As a Party to a Crime, in the manner and form as charged in count 4 of the amended information relating to Brian B.
"We, the jury, find the defendant, GUILTY of Robbery, (Use of force), As a Party to a Crime, in the manner and form as charged in count 5 of the amended information relating to Brett Z.
"We, the jury, find the defendant, GUILTY of Operating Vehicle Without Owner's Consent, (Take and Drive), As a Party to a Crime, in the manner and form as charged in count 6 of the amended information relating to Brett Z.   
"We, the jury, find the defendant, GUILTY of Substantial Battery (Substantial Bodily Harm with Intent to Cause Bodily Harm),  As a Party to a Crime, in the manner and form as charged in count 7 of the amended information relating to Brett Z.
"We, the jury, find the defendant, GUILTY of Armed Robbery, (Use of force), As a Party to a Crime, in the manner and form as charged in count 8 of the amended information relating to Heather S.  
"We, the jury, find the defendant, GUILTY of Robbery, (Use of force), As a Party to a Crime, in the manner and form as charged in count 9 of the amended information relating to Samuel S.  
"We, the jury, find the defendant, GUILTY of Substantial Battery (Substantial Bodily Harm with Intent to Cause Bodily Harm),  As a Party to a Crime, in the manner and form as charged in count 10 of the amended information relating to Samuel S.
"We, the jury, find the defendant, GUILTY of Operating Vehicle Without Owner's Consent, (Take and Drive), As a Party to a Crime, in the manner and form as charged in count 6 of the amended information relating to Samuel S. 
 
On direction of the Court, deputy clerk polled the jury and each juror acknowledged the correctness of the verdict.  Verdict received and filed.  Court discharged the jury.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction on all counts.   Filed, Exhibit List, Jury Instructions and jury questions.  

PSI ordered.  Defendant is REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department pending sentencing.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.   Case scheduled for sentencing on March 3, 2016 at 8:30 am.

Defendant Jerrell L Washington in court with attorney Joseph Richard Reback.  Defendant Jerrell L Washington in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Trial continued.  Jury in box at 9:12 am.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 10:05 am to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies Cross and Matienzo who were duly sworn for that purpose.

Defendant Jerrell L Washington in court with attorney Joseph Richard Reback.  Defendant Jerrell L Washington in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Trial continued.  Jury in box at 1:38 pm.  Sworn for the state: West Allis Police Officer Michael Dobschuetz, West Allis Police Officer Kyle Webster, West Allis Police Officer Kevyn Mussatti, Shorewood Police Officer Ian Moss, Shorewood Police Detective Lora Vander Schaaf.  Jury out of box at 2:02 pm.  Exhibits # 1-26 offered and received.  On the motion of the state, the Court changes the word "their" to "his" as to counts 5 and 9 in the amended information.  State rests subject to rebuttal.  Defense motion to dismiss at close of evidence argued and denied by the court.  Jury in box at 2:13 pm.  State and defense rest.   Jury out of box at 2:16 pm.  Defense renews motion to dismiss, the Court denies defense's motion.    Jury in box at 3:31 pm.  Court instructed jury.  Jury out of box at 4:17 pm.  Court recessed for the day.  Court ordered case adjourned for jury trial on January 28, 2016 at 8:30 am in Branch 26.  Jury trial scheduled for January 28, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jerrell L Washington in court with attorney Joseph Richard Reback.  Defendant Jerrell L Washington in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Trial continued.  Jury in box at 8:54 am.  Sworn testimony continued:  District Attorney Investigator Robert Stelter.  Exhibit #19 offered and received.  Sworn for state:  Shorewood Police Officer Nicholas Taraboi.  Jury out of box at 10:10 am for a break.  Jury in box at 10:47 am.   Sworn for state:  DA Analyst Nicole Smith, DNA Analyst Stephanie Kuntz.  Exhibits #23, 24 offered and received.  Sworn for state:  Milwaukee Police Detective Angela Juarez.  Jury out of box at 11:37 am.  

On the oral motion of the state, the Court amends Count 9, Armed Robbery of the amended information to Robbery Use of Force, as a party to a crime, a Class E Felony.  Court recessed for lunch.

Defendant Jerrell L Washington in court with attorney Joseph Richard Reback.  Defendant Jerrell L Washington in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Trial continued.  Jury in box at 3:47 pm.  Sworn for the state:  Retired Milwaukee Police Detective Robert St. Onge, District Attorney Investigator Robert Stelter.  Jury out of box at 4:47 pm.  Court ordered case ajourned for jury trial on January 27, 2016 at 8:30 am in Branch 26.

  Jury trial scheduled for January 27, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jerrell L Washington in court with attorney Joseph Richard Reback.  Defendant Jerrell L Washington in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Motion hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  Retired Milwaukee Police Detective Robert St. Onge.  Arguments by state and defense.  The Court finds there is no basis to grant the motion to suppress testimony.

Defendant Jerrell L Washington in court with attorney Joseph Richard Reback.  Defendant Jerrell L Washington in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Trial continued.  Jury in box at 1:37 pm.  Sworn for the state: Sam S. Whitefish Bay Police Officer Russell Blank, Shorewood Police Sargent Karl Simandl.  Exhibit # 5 offered and received. Sworn for the state:  Shorewood Police Officer Cody Smith.  Jury out of box at 3:02 pm for break.  Jury in box at 3:16 pm.  Continued sworn testimony from Shorewood Police Officer Cody Smith.  Jury out of box at 3:26 pm.

Defendant Jerrell L Washington in court with attorney Joseph Richard Reback.  Defendant Jerrell L Washington in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Trial continued. Jury in box at 9:05 am.   Jurors were duly impanelled and sworn.  Jury list received and filed.  Court ordered witnesses sequestered.  Court instructed jury.  Opening statement by state, defense reserves opening statement.   Sworn for the state:  Ryan G.  Jury out of box at 10:13 am for break.  Jury in box at 10:44 am.  Sworn for the state:  Brian B., Heather S., Jeremy B., Brett Z.  Jury out of box at 11:50 am.  Court recessed for lunch.
Jury Questions.vmb

filed.  Count 1:  Robbery, Armed (Use of force) - PTAC, As a Party to a Crime, contrary to sec 943.32(1)(a) and (2), 939.50(3)(c), 939.05 Wis. Stats. a Class C Felony.
